description.css: Do you want to copy the CSS properties into your own files or create a new one?
description.less: Do you want to copy the LESS variables into your own files or create a new one?
description.scss: Do you want to copy the SCSS variables into your own files or create a new one?
description.tailwind: Do you want to copy the colors into your existing TailwindCSS config file or create an extra file for your palette?

format.description: Choose the format you want to export your palette in.
format.title: Pick a format

request-format.description: If you find a format missing, please check if it is already requested on GitHub. If not, you can create a new issue there and I will try to add it as soon as possible.
request-format.title: Missing a format?

css.copy:
The palette has been copied to your clipboard. To use the colors as CSS properties copy the contents of the clipboard to the {{ root }} of your css file.

Now you can use your colors by referencing them like:
{{ usage }}
css.file:
Move the downloaded {{ file }} file to the root of your webserver. Then link it in the head of your html file like:
{{ link }}

Now you can use your colors by referencing them like:
{{ usage }}

less.copy:
The palette has been copied to your clipboard. To use the colors as LESS variables copy the contents of the clipboard to the top of your less file.

Now you can use your colors by referencing them like:
{{ usage }}
less.file:
Move the downloaded {{ file }} file to the root of your project. Then link it in the head of your less files like:
{{ link }}

Now you can use your colors by referencing them like:
{{ usage }}

scss.copy:
The palette has been copied to your clipboard. To use the colors as SCSS variables copy the contents of the clipboard to the top of your scss file.

Now you can use your colors by referencing them like:
{{ usage }}
scss.file:
Move the downloaded {{ file }} file to the root of your project. Then link it in the head of your scss files like:
{{ link }}

Now you can use your colors by referencing them like:
{{ usage }}

tailwind.copy:
The palette has been copied to your clipboard. To use the colors copy the contents of the clipboard to the {{ config }} file.

Check TailwindsCSS's documentation for further instructions.
tailwind.file:
Move the downloaded {{ file }} file to the root of your project. Then import the colors in your {{ config }} file like:
{{ import }}

Check TailwindCSS's documentation for further instructions.

generator.description: Enter a hex code below or pick a color to get started.
generator.title: Generate an entire color palette from just a single color.

manual.cta:
That's it!
It's that easy to create your very own color palette.
manual.description: You can create your very own color palette in just 3 simple steps.

download.description: When you're finished you can export your personal palette in the format of your choice. So far this site supports both CSS variables and TailwindCSS. In addition, with each format you have the choice between the pure code or a file that you can easily integrate into your existing project.
download.title: Export

edit.description: After the algorithm has finished the generation, editing begins. Now you can view your palette and adjust the colors using the "tune" icon. If you just want to try it out and complete the palette later, your progress can be saved locally in your browser for later.
edit.title: Editing

generate.description: Just pick your favorite color or enter your brand color and hit "generate". If you want, you can optionally select a specific color scheme, otherwise you will get a rainbow color scheme. The algorithm then starts to add more colors to match yours and generates 10 different shades for each one.
generate.title: Generation

manual.title: How it works

development.description: Unfortunately, at the moment I don't have much time to actively improve the tool myself. Nevertheless, I monitor the activities of the {{ github }} repository on the side. So if you have any ideas on how the tool could be expanded, want to implement new interfaces yourself or can improve my algorithms, feel free to contact me on my {{ discord }}.
development.title: Development

roadmap.description: Even though I can't develop the tool myself at the moment, I have a few features planned. These include:

issue.15: Adjust colors in different formats (RGB, HSV)
issue.17: Exemplary web components to preview palette

roadmap.title: Roadmap

footer.description: Generate an entire color palette from just a single color.

description.preview: You don't have a palette yet. You have to generate one first before you can preview it.
description.view: You don't have a palette yet. You have to generate one first before you can edit it.

error.load-color-map: An error occurred while loading the list of color names.
error.palette-load: An error occurred while loading your last palette.

copy.error: An error occurred while copying the hex code to your clipboard.
copy.success: "{{ color }}" has been copied to your clipboard.

color.remove: Are you sure you want to remove the color "{{ color }}"?
color.removed: The color "{{ color }}" has been removed.
color.rename: Enter a new name for the color:
color.renamed: Your color has been renamed to "{{ name }}".

palette.rename: Enter a new name for the palette:
palette.renamed: Your palette has been renamed to "{{ name }}".
